"First the others, then oneself—bestowing kindness upon the myriad beings, extending merit to all things. When merit fills the three thousand, one ascends to heaven in broad daylight; with virtue cultivated in abundance, clouds and chariots descend from the heavens. To propagate the Dao without cease is to attain immortality of oneself. These are the supreme precepts of fundamental conduct—how could one not reverently uphold them?

First: One must succor the dying and protect the living, rescuing those in dire peril, that life may fulfill its destined span without untimely harm.
Second: One must heal the sick and treat the afflicted, carrying those in grave distress, that the body may attain safety without enduring agony.
Third: One must bestow kindness upon the destitute, deliver those in peril, and sacrifice one’s own to aid others, without stinginess or reluctance.
Fourth: One must serve and honor the masters and treasures, establish quiet abodes, and broadly perform meritorious deeds, without weariness or slackening.
Fifth: One must transcribe and collate scriptures, recite and pay homage morning and evening, offer incense and lamps, and maintain a mind free from negligence or arrogance.
Sixth: One must cultivate abstinence and contemplate the Dao, reverently uphold the Dharma, purify both inner and outer, and refrain from generating defilement or evil.
Seventh: One must withdraw from worldly pursuits to protect righteousness, avoid contention for fame and merit, embrace simplicity and preserve purity, and act in accordance with the natural.
Eighth: One must enlighten the ignorant and vulgar, admonish and dispel evil, guiding all to single-minded devotion in venerating the Great Dharma.
Ninth: One must dig wells along roadsides, plant orchards and groves, instruct the young and unlearned, and exhort others to perform good deeds.
Tenth: One’s conduct must serve as a model, movements and stillness must be worthy of observation, teachings and systems must provide guidance, and actions must always remain thus.

These ten meritorious causes are the supreme precepts of the precept-code, revered by the Ten Heavenly Kings. Those who practice them attain merit equal to that of the flying immortals.

Next, one must maintain vigilance in conduct and speech: when addressing a ruler, one’s words should benefit the state; when addressing a father, they should foster kindness toward his children; when addressing a teacher, they should inspire love for the multitude; when addressing an elder brother, they should cultivate fraternal respect in action; when addressing a minister, they should uphold loyalty to the sovereign; when addressing a child, they should nurture filial piety toward parents; when addressing a friend, they should foster trust in fellowship; when addressing a wife, they should encourage chastity toward her husband; when addressing a husband, they should promote harmony in the household; when addressing a disciple, they should cultivate reverence for propriety; when addressing a rustic, they should encourage diligence in agriculture; when addressing a Daoist, they should rectify the Dao; when addressing a foreigner, they should ensure each remains within their own domain; when addressing servants and maids, they should exercise caution in their duties.

These fourteen precepts on maintaining personal conduct are constantly revered by the Four Heavenly Emperor-Kings. They are universally proclaimed to the noble spirits of the four directions, the people of all walks, and men and women alike, that all may practice these supreme precepts and ascend to the natural halls of bliss of the Four Heavens. Those who practice them are esteemed by the Four Heavens, praised by the earthly spirits, and their rank equals that of the Immortal Kings.

Next, there are the one hundred and eighty upper precepts, eighty middle precepts, and forty lower precepts, together with the three grades of the Primordial Beginning’s wisdom precepts, compiled into the *Great Precepts for Observing the Body*, totaling three hundred. Unless one possesses the virtue of a superior immortal, with a body pervading the Three Clarities and a nature merged with the natural, none can uphold them.

In the degenerate age, the minds of men and women will be corrupted, their conduct gradually lax and indulgent, filled with doubt and division. Pursuits and competitions will be myriad, and those who preserve the truth will be few. They will surely be unable to revere and uphold the *Precepts for Observing the Body*. Having failed to observe them, they will inevitably incur great calamity.

Now, the upper ten precepts are compiled to deliver beings and broadly propagate transformation, guiding them into the Dharma gate. Those who diligently uphold them will attain the blessings of the natural and the Dao of non-action.

The Ten Precepts are as follows:
First: Do not envy those superior to oneself or suppress the worthy and wise.
Second: Do not indulge in wine or licentiousness, defiling the Three Palaces.
Third: Do not commit adultery with another’s spouse or covet sensual pleasures.
Fourth: Do not abandon or despise the elderly, sick, destitute, or lowly.
Fifth: Do not slander the virtuous or malign fellow practitioners.
Sixth: Do not hoard treasures and refuse to bestow or distribute them.
Seventh: Do not kill living beings to sacrifice to the Six Heavenly Ghost-Spirits.
Eighth: Do not arbitrarily discuss scriptures, dismissing them as false and absurd.
Ninth: Do not betray the kindness and righteousness of one’s teacher, feigning devotion as a new disciple.
Tenth: Maintain an equanimous mind and practice benevolence and filial piety toward all.

These Ten Precepts are universally taught throughout the boundless worlds to deliver all beings. Those who uphold them will have their merit recorded in the Ten Heavens, their blessings extending to seven generations of ancestors, lifting them from the long night of the Nine Dark Realms to ascend to the Southern Palace. Their bodies will enter the radiance of light, their karmic connections unbroken, and they will attain the state of divine immortals. With all practices fulfilled, one must avoid the Ten Evils, distance oneself from the blind path, and sever the roots of sin.

The Ten Evils are as follows:
First: Indulging in wine and lust, with insatiable greed and desire.
Second: Secretly harming the world and slandering Daoists.
Third: Disrespecting teachers and the Dharma, arrogantly neglecting the Three Treasures.
Fourth: Stealing scriptures and recklessly proclaiming the essentials of the Dao.
Fifth: Borrowing and failing to return, deceiving and misleading the people.
Sixth: Killing living beings for taste, with a mouth that praises but a heart that denies.
Seventh: Being unfilial, betraying kindness, violating righteousness, and transgressing all prohibitions.
Eighth: Reciting scriptures carelessly, being haughty and self-righteous.
Ninth: Demanding compliance with one’s expectations, harboring anger toward the four classes of beings.
Tenth: Distorting the meaning of scriptures, altering or diminishing the sacred texts, disbelieving in past lives, indulging in reckless desires, defiling and disdaining the Four Great Elements, and neglecting the path of life.

These Ten Evils cannot be separated from the body. Those who violate them will suffer myriad misfortunes, their lives harmed by ghosts and spirits, enduring endless torment without a moment’s peace. Though they tread the path of goodness, they will encounter evil, and all their endeavors will fail. Upon death, they will enter hell, confined in the heavy barriers of the long night, never beholding the Three Lights, drifting day and night. They will embrace the bronze pillars, tread the knife mountains, traverse the sword trees, plunge into cauldrons of boiling water, swallow fire and eat coals, enduring the five sufferings in full. They will be eternally submerged in the Nine Dark Realms, without hope of rebirth. Even if they attain liberation, they will be reborn among the six kinds of animals, never regaining human form. Evil draws evil, just as goodness begets goodness. The retribution of sin and blessing is like the sunlight descending, while the unceasing cycle of life and death follows the shadow accompanying the form. Karmic consequences accumulate like the turning of a wheel."

chunks.original_text: 今说是戒，护度天人，明识谛受，勤行勿忘。 若清信士女，必能保持十戒，才力兼赡，欲勤行精进，广施众善者，可授十二可从，开示十善十四持身之品也。 天尊言：夫为学者修斋求道，开度天人，作诸善功，当行十二可从戒，而得度世者，尔宜从之，自得正真，终入无为，所愿皆成。 十二可从戒者： 一者，见真经正法，开度一切，便发道意，心愿后世得登大圣。 二者，常行慈心，愿念一切，普得见法，开度广远，无有障碍。 三者，好乐经教，深远览达，意志坚明，开化愚暗。 四者，遵受师训，广开劝化，令入法墙，远离盲道。 五者，信向玄妙，尊奉经诀，晨夕诵习，无有怠倦。 六者，不务荣华，断绝因缘，专心定志，所营在法。 七者，勤诵大经，愿念一切，广开桥梁，为来生作善绿。 八者，恒生善心，不邪不伪，无嫉无害，无恶无拓。 九者，在所随生，常值圣世，兴灵宝法教，相值不绝。 十者，洁身持戒，修斋建功，广救群生，咸得度脱。 十一者，学业广览，宣通同法，预以天人，普令开度。 十二者，常与明师，世世相值，受教宣化，度人无量，一切善心，皆得道真 天尊言：夫学士治行之法，当行十二可从之戒。 能以一心行此善念，世世得见圣，与道结缘，诸天友识，独步三界，无所挂碍。 长离三恶五道八难，神明敬护，地祇拥卫，门户清肃，万灾不干，可谓端坐而得道也。 勤为习诵，广宣同学，皆使一切齐入法门。 是时，天尊说戒都毕，太上道君、十方至真、无极大圣、高玄真人，欢喜作礼，一时东向稽首伏地。 太上道君前进长跪，上白天尊言：众真侍坐，得闻法音，诸天踊跃，喜庆难胜。 大法既兴，普度天人，来生男女，当受此恩。 然见世愚聋，未见命根，不知罪福，所从何来，虽加开悟，不信者众。 已垂训喻，愿卒皇恩普赐，十方无极世界百姓子男女人，同时开悟，得见宿命善恶因缘，罪福报应，知有命根，普天获济，法教日隆。 於是天尊放身威光，内外洞彻，照明十方，无幽无隐，无极无穷，一时晓明，如见眼前。 是男是女，悉是诸天之上福堂善人，逍遥无为，欢乐自然。 下见诸地九幽之府，长夜之中，囚徒作役，饿鬼畜生，流曳死魂，首体髡截，无复身形，幽闭重槛，不睹三光。 百姓男女并见命根罪福缘对善恶之报，莫不震惶、一时归心，宗奉大法，修行众善，投命天尊，伏从禁戒，无复退转，福德普匝，欢乐难言，不胜喜庆。 诸天大圣莫不称善，故作颂曰： 十天轮空洞，死生从中归。 善恶各生根，缘对初无亏。 昔见清信士，故得十天飞。 历观九幽夜，苦魂攀岭悲。 长河难闭塞，刀山不可回。 轮转五道中，恻怆伤人怀。 天尊说禁戒，朗朗长夜开。 诸天并欢悦，斯乐难可偕。 天尊言：今当命使诸天神人说诸罪录，宣通法音，开悟群生，觉诸天人，善男子、善女人。 令知身行罪恶命根，因缘不绝，殃对相寻，流曳三涂五道之中，魂形苦恼，亿劫无还。 故说是戒，令入法门，开度九幽，拔出苦根，使生者见道，身脱八难，死者欢乐，上升天堂，早生人中，转轮圣王，生死庆泰，世世长存。 预以信向，皆当精心，奉戒持斋，自得道真，慎行勤修，谛受勿忘，能同大法，便当伏听。

Here now is the precept expounded, to shield and ferry gods and humans, to illuminate and discern, to receive with clarity, and to practice diligently without forgetfulness.

If faithful men and women can steadfastly uphold the Ten Precepts, their capacity and strength both ample, and aspire to practice with diligence and advance in purity, widely bestowing manifold goodness, they may be conferred the Twelve Permissible Observances, and instructed in the Ten Virtues and the Fourteen Rules for Conduct.

The Heavenly Worthy declared: Those who study, perform purification rites, and seek the Dao, who deliver gods and humans and perform all meritorious deeds, ought to practice the Twelve Permissible Precepts. Through these, they may attain deliverance from the world. You should follow them, thereby attaining true perfection and ultimately entering the realm of non-action, with all aspirations fulfilled.

The Twelve Permissible Precepts are as follows:

First, upon encountering true scriptures and the orthodox Dharma, delivering all beings, one should awaken the Dao-mind, vowing that in future lives one may ascend to the rank of great sage.

Second, one should constantly practice a heart of compassion, wishing that all beings may behold the Dharma, be delivered far and wide, without obstruction.

Third, one should delight in the scriptural teachings, deeply and broadly comprehending them, with a will firm and bright, enlightening the ignorant and benighted.

Fourth, one should follow the instructions of one’s teacher, widely exhorting and transforming others, guiding them into the enclosure of the Dharma, far from blind paths.

Fifth, one should trust in and turn toward the profound and wondrous, reverently upholding the scriptural instructions, reciting and studying them morning and evening without weariness or sloth.

Sixth, one should not pursue glory and splendor, severing karmic entanglements, concentrating the mind and fixing the will, with all endeavors directed toward the Dharma.

Seventh, one should diligently recite the great scriptures, wishing for all beings, widely building bridges, and creating good causes for future lives.

Eighth, one should constantly generate a heart of goodness, neither deviant nor false, without jealousy or harm, without malice or obstruction.

Ninth, wherever one is reborn, one should always encounter a sagely age, with the Lingbao teachings flourishing, never failing to meet them.

Tenth, one should purify the body and uphold the precepts, perform purification rites and establish merit, widely rescuing all beings, that all may attain deliverance.

Eleventh, one should broadly study and comprehend the teachings, propagating and communicating them to fellow practitioners, thereby including gods and humans, universally delivering all.

Twelfth, one should always encounter enlightened teachers, life after life, receiving instruction and propagating transformation, delivering countless beings. All good intentions shall attain the true Dao.

The Heavenly Worthy declared: The method for scholars to cultivate conduct lies in practicing the Twelve Permissible Precepts. If one can practice these good intentions with a single mind, life after life one will behold the sagely, form karmic bonds with the Dao, befriend the gods, and walk alone through the Three Realms without hindrance. One will forever depart from the Three Evil Paths, the Five Destinies, and the Eight Difficulties. Divine spirits will respect and protect, earthly deities will surround and guard. One’s household will be pure and solemn, myriad calamities will not encroach. Truly, one may sit upright and attain the Dao.

Diligently study and recite, widely propagate to fellow learners, that all may together enter the Dharma-gate.

At that time, when the Heavenly Worthy had finished expounding the precepts, the Most High Lord of the Dao, the Perfected of the Ten Directions, the Boundless Great Sages, and the Lofty Transcendent Ones all rejoiced, made obeisance, and simultaneously faced east, prostrating themselves to the ground.

The Most High Lord of the Dao advanced, knelt, and addressed the Heavenly Worthy, saying: "All the Perfected in attendance, having heard the Dharma-sound, and the gods of the heavens, leap for joy, their delight beyond measure. As the Great Dharma flourishes, it universally delivers gods and humans. In future lives, men and women shall receive this grace. Yet we see that the world’s foolish and deaf do not perceive the root of destiny, nor know the consequences of sin and blessing, whence they arise. Though exhorted and awakened, many do not believe. Having already bestowed instruction and admonition, we now pray that Your August Grace be universally bestowed, that the men, women, and children of the boundless worlds in the ten directions may simultaneously awaken, perceive the karmic conditions of past lives—good and evil, the retribution of sin and blessing—and know the root of destiny. May all under heaven attain deliverance, and the Dharma-teachings daily flourish."

Thereupon, the Heavenly Worthy emitted the radiance of his majestic body, illuminating within and without, shining through the ten directions. No darkness remained hidden, no bound was left unpervaded. All was instantly illuminated, as if seen before one’s eyes. All men and women were revealed as blessed beings from the halls of goodness above the heavens, carefree and at ease, their joy natural. Below, they beheld the Nine Dark Realms of the earthly prisons, the long night’s confines, where prisoners toiled, hungry ghosts and beasts, drifting dead souls, their heads and bodies shorn and severed, no longer possessing human form. They were shut in heavy barriers, never beholding the Three Lights. All men and women saw the root of destiny, the karmic conditions of sin and blessing, the retribution of good and evil. None were not struck with awe, all simultaneously turned their hearts, revered and upheld the Great Dharma, practiced manifold goodness, entrusted their lives to the Heavenly Worthy, and submitted to the prohibitions and precepts, never again turning back. Blessings and virtue universally pervaded, their joy indescribable, their delight beyond measure.

The Great Sages of the heavens all extolled the good, and composed a hymn, saying:

The Ten Heavens wheel through the empty void,
Life and death return therein.
Good and evil each bear their roots,
Karmic conditions never fail in their response.
Of old, we saw the faithful,
Thus ascending the Ten Heavens.
Gazing upon the long night of the Nine Dark Realms,
The suffering souls climb the sorrowful peaks.
The Long River cannot be dammed,
The Knife Mountains cannot be turned back.
Revolving in the Five Paths,
Pity and sorrow fill the heart.
The Heavenly Worthy expounds the prohibitions,
Brightly dispelling the long night.
The heavens all rejoice,
This joy cannot be matched.

The Heavenly Worthy declared: Now I shall command the divine messengers and gods of the heavens to proclaim the records of sins, propagate the Dharma-sound, awaken all beings, and enlighten the gods and humans—good men and good women. Let them know the karmic roots of bodily actions, sin, and evil, the unbroken conditions, the calamitous consequences that pursue, drifting in the Three Wretched Paths and the Five Destinies, where souls and forms suffer torment, for kalpas without return. Therefore, these precepts are expounded, to guide them into the Dharma-gate, deliver the Nine Dark Realms, extract the roots of suffering, that the living may behold the Dao and escape the Eight Difficulties, the dead may rejoice and ascend to the heavens, be reborn early among humans, become Wheel-Turning Sage Kings, and in life and death know peace, existing for ages unending. Those who beforehand trust and turn toward the Dharma should all concentrate their minds, uphold the precepts and perform purification rites, thereby attaining the true Dao. Be cautious in practice, diligent in cultivation, receive with clarity and never forget. Those who can align with the Great Dharma should now submit and listen.

chunks.original_text: 太上洞玄灵宝智慧罪根上品大戒经卷上竟 太上洞玄灵宝智慧罪根上品大戒经卷下 东极世界飞天神人曰：东方无极世界恒沙众生，已得道过去及未得道见在福中善男子善女人，修奉智慧上品十戒，功满福报，致得乘空，白日飞行，驾景策龙，上登玉清，游行东极九炁天中。 未得道者，生世富贵，位为人尊，年命长远，并无夭伤。 东方青帝，皆即列名、奏言九炁上天九炁天官，告下东方三官九署地牢之中，削落青元九幽玉匮长夜之函宿世罪根。 青天司命勒录诸天神仙簿中，七祖皆得上升天堂，衣食自然，随年更生帝王之门，世世欢乐，恒居福中，因缘不绝，故得信根。 太上道君顾问东极世界飞天神人曰：我尝历观诸天，出游东门，见东方无极世界地狱之中，有百姓子男女人身受考挞，诸痛备婴，形体毁悴，苦毒难言。 见之悲伤，谪役几年，当得解脱，为还人中，更还恶缘。 如此之辈，当作何功德，以拔此怨，使得开度，还入善门。 东极世界飞天神人曰：其人所犯元恶罪录，结在九幽长夜之函，九炁天君青天灵官三界司算结其目录，依玄都女青上宫左官律，九万劫得还，生非人之道，输转九亿万劫。 天地数极，乃得作九河都役使，此之辛苦，非可能言。 欲得开度，断绝恶缘，当依明真玉匮女青上宫科品，以青纹之缯九十尺，亦可九尺，金龙一枚，诣东方九炁天君东乡诸灵官，九幽之中，拔赎苦魂，绝诸罪根。 九日九夜，明灯烧香，首谢天君，九幽之下，得见光明，可得解脱，还入善缘。 九年皆得还生人中，世世欢乐，福庆无穷。 东南世界飞天神人曰：东南无极世界恒沙众生，已得道过去及未得道见在福中善男子善女人，修奉智慧上品十戒，功满福报，名书上清，或位登上圣，或为神仙，游行五岳，驾龙乘虚，见在世上，为人师宗，万姓所仰，三界所敬，门户清贵，福庆无穷。 东南地司皆列名上言梵炁上天，梵炁天官告下东南三官九府百二十曹，削落黄元九幽玉匮长夜之函宿世罪根。 梵天司命勒录梵天神仙籍中，七祖普得去离三涂，上升天堂，衣饭天厨。 一十二年皆得更生福德之门，帝王之家，世世欢乐，轮转因缘，遂得飞仙。 太上道君顾问东南世界飞天神人曰：我尝历观诸天，出游东南门，见东南无极世界地狱之中，有百姓子男女人，受此恶对，苦毒难言，见之悲伤，甚可哀愍。 被责几年，当得解脱，蒙赦之日，为生人中，为作可形，如此之辈，有何功德，可相解度。 东南世界飞天神人曰：斯人所行，罪在酷逆，结於九幽长夜之函，一炁天君梵炁诸灵官三界司等结其罪录，依玄都女青中宫中官律，万劫得还，生贱人之中，身婴六极，或抱残伤，或生弃疾，轮转十二万劫无数之周，乃得作东岳都役使。 其人艰辛，非可能言。 欲得拔度，还於善缘，当依明真玉匮女青中宫科品，以黄文之缯一百二十尺，亦可一十二尺，金龙一枚，诣东南梵炁天君东南诸灵官九幽之中，拔赎罪魂。 一十二日一十二夜，明灯烧香，首谢天君，可得开度，见诸光明，一十二年皆得还生福德之门，世世欢乐，永享无穷。 南方无极世界飞天神人曰：南方无极世界恒沙众生，已得道过去及未得道见在福中善男子善女人，修奉智慧上品十戒，功满德备，丹天福报，已得道者，位登上真，或为神仙，或为灵官，或得灭度。

The Lower Scroll of the *Highest Cavern Mystery Numinous Treasure Scripture of the Wisdom Roots of Transgressions, Upper Grade Precepts* begins.

The Flying Heavenly Deity of the Eastern Ultimate World declares: In the Eastern Boundless World, the multitude of beings as numerous as the sands of the Ganges—those who have already attained the Dao in past lives and those presently virtuous men and women of good fortune who have yet to attain the Dao—who cultivate and uphold the Ten Upper-Grade Precepts of Wisdom, when their merit is complete and their blessings fulfilled, shall ascend through the void, soaring in broad daylight, riding upon the radiance and spurring dragons, ascending to the Jade Purity, and roaming amidst the Nine Qi Heavens of the Eastern Ultimate.

Those who have not yet attained the Dao shall be born into wealth and nobility in the world, occupying honored positions among humans, with long lifespans and no premature death.

The Azure Emperor of the East shall inscribe their names and memorialize the Nine Qi Heaven, the Nine Qi Heavenly Officials, who shall then decree to the Three Offices and Nine Bureaus of the Eastern Earthly Prisons, erasing their names from the Azure Register of the Nine Dark Realms and the Everlasting Night Scrolls of the Jade Casket, severing the roots of their past-life transgressions.

The Life-Commanders of the Azure Heaven shall record them in the registers of heavenly immortals, and their seven generations of ancestors shall all ascend to the heavens, clothed and fed by nature, reborn in successive generations into the gates of emperors and kings, rejoicing in life after life, forever dwelling in good fortune, their karmic conditions unbroken, thus attaining the root of faith.

The Most High Dao Lord turned and asked the Flying Heavenly Deity of the Eastern Ultimate World: "I have often traversed the heavens and journeyed through the Eastern Gate, where I beheld in the Eastern Boundless World’s hells the common folk—men and women—enduring floggings and torments, their bodies afflicted with every pain, their forms emaciated and withered, their suffering beyond words. Witnessing this, I grieved deeply. How many years must they endure this penal servitude before they may be released, return to the human realm, and escape their evil karmic conditions? What meritorious deeds must such beings perform to extricate themselves from this enmity, attain deliverance, and re-enter the gate of goodness?"

The Flying Heavenly Deity of the Eastern Ultimate World replied: "The transgressions of these beings are recorded in the Everlasting Night Scrolls of the Nine Dark Realms. The Nine Qi Heavenly Lords, the Azure Heavenly Numinous Officials, and the Three Realms’ Registrars have tallied their offenses. According to the statutes of the Left Bureau of the Jade Maiden of the Mysterious Capital’s Upper Palace, they must endure ninety thousand kalpas before they may return, reborn into non-human destinies, and undergo transmigration for ninety million kalpas. Only when the reckoning of heaven and earth is exhausted may they serve as laborers in the Nine Rivers, their hardships beyond description. To attain deliverance and sever their evil karmic conditions, they must follow the regulations of the Luminous Perfected Jade Casket and the Jade Maiden of the Upper Palace’s statutes: present ninety feet of azure-patterned silk (or nine feet), and one golden dragon, to the Nine Qi Heavenly Lord of the East and the Eastern Numinous Officials of the Nine Dark Realms, to redeem and extricate the suffering souls, cutting off the roots of their transgressions. For nine days and nine nights, they must illuminate lamps, burn incense, and prostrate in repentance before the Heavenly Lord. Then, in the depths of the Nine Dark Realms, they shall behold the light and attain liberation, re-entering the conditions of goodness. Within nine years, they shall all be reborn among humans, rejoicing in life after life, their blessings and felicity boundless."

The Flying Heavenly Deity of the Southeastern World declares: In the Southeastern Boundless World, the multitude of beings as numerous as the sands of the Ganges—those who have already attained the Dao in past lives and those presently virtuous men and women of good fortune who have yet to attain the Dao—who cultivate and uphold the Ten Upper-Grade Precepts of Wisdom, when their merit is complete and their virtue perfected, shall receive the blessings of the Cinnabar Heaven. Those who have attained the Dao shall ascend to the rank of Highest Perfected, become immortals or numinous officials, or attain extinction.

Their names shall be inscribed in the Upper Clarity, and they may ascend to the ranks of highest sages or become immortals, roaming the Five Peaks, riding dragons and traversing the void. In the present world, they shall serve as teachers and exemplars to humanity, revered by the myriad clans, respected by the Three Realms, their households noble and pure, their blessings and felicity boundless.

The Southeastern Earthly Offices shall inscribe their names and memorialize the Brahma Qi Heaven, the Brahma Qi Heavenly Officials, who shall then decree to the Three Offices, Nine Courts, and One Hundred Twenty Bureaus of the Southeast, erasing their names from the Yellow Register of the Nine Dark Realms and the Everlasting Night Scrolls of the Jade Casket, severing the roots of their past-life transgressions.

The Life-Commanders of the Brahma Heaven shall record them in the registers of Brahma Heaven’s immortals, and their seven generations of ancestors shall all depart the Three Wretched Realms, ascend to the heavens, and feast upon the celestial kitchens. Within twelve years, they shall all be reborn into the gates of good fortune and virtue, the households of emperors and kings, rejoicing in life after life, their karmic conditions revolving until they attain the flight of immortals.

The Most High Dao Lord turned and asked the Flying Heavenly Deity of the Southeastern World: "I have often traversed the heavens and journeyed through the Southeastern Gate, where I beheld in the Southeastern Boundless World’s hells the common folk—men and women—enduring these evil retributions, their suffering beyond words. Witnessing this, I grieved deeply, filled with pity. How many years must they endure punishment before they may be released? When pardoned, they shall be reborn among humans, assuming whatever forms they may. What meritorious deeds must such beings perform to attain deliverance?"

The Flying Heavenly Deity of the Southeastern World replied: "The transgressions of these beings are of the cruelest and most perverse kind, recorded in the Everlasting Night Scrolls of the Nine Dark Realms. The One Qi Heavenly Lord, the Brahma Qi Numinous Officials, and the Three Realms’ Registrars have tallied their offenses. According to the statutes of the Central Bureau of the Jade Maiden of the Mysterious Capital’s Central Palace, they must endure ten thousand kalpas before they may return, reborn among the lowly, their bodies afflicted with the Six Extremities, bearing deformities or chronic illnesses. They shall undergo transmigration for twelve myriad kalpas without number before they may serve as laborers in the Eastern Peak. Their hardships are beyond description. To attain deliverance and return to the conditions of goodness, they must follow the regulations of the Luminous Perfected Jade Casket and the Jade Maiden of the Central Palace’s statutes: present one hundred twenty feet of yellow-patterned silk (or twelve feet), and one golden dragon, to the Brahma Qi Heavenly Lord of the Southeast and the Southeastern Numinous Officials of the Nine Dark Realms, to redeem and extricate the sinful souls. For twelve days and twelve nights, they must illuminate lamps, burn incense, and prostrate in repentance before the Heavenly Lord. Then they shall attain deliverance, behold the light, and within twelve years, all shall be reborn into the gates of good fortune and virtue, rejoicing in life after life, forever enjoying boundless blessings."

chunks.original_text: 见在世上，聪明智慧，逆知吉凶，或通灵彻视，役使鬼神，或在富贵帝王之门。 南方赤帝南极地司，皆列名上言三炁丹天三炁天官，告下南方三官九府百二十曹，削除赤元九幽玉匮长夜之函宿世罪根。 丹天司命注上丹天神仙籍中，七祖普得去离三涂，上升天堂，逍遥南宫，三年皆得更生福德之门，世世欢乐，福庆难称，善缘不绝，克得神仙。 太上道君顾问南极世界飞天神人曰：我尝历观诸天，出游南门，见南方无极世界地狱之中，有百姓子男女人，裸身无衣，吞火食炭，头面焦燎，举体烂坏，无复人形，身受恶对，苦毒难言。 见之流曳，伤痛人心。 如此之辈，受对几年，当得解脱，被赦之日，为还人中，为作何形，大慈之法，有何功德，可得解度，还於善缘。 南极世界飞天神人曰：其人酷逆，生世不道，罪结九幽长夜之府，三炁天君丹天诸灵官三界司算结其罪录，依玄都女青阳宫太阳官律，罪役皆三万劫，当还生六畜之中，以报宿怨。 三百万劫轮转丹天数周，乃得作三河水曹都役使，其间辛苦，非可得言。 若欲开度，断诸恶缘，使得速还人道之中，当依明真玉匮女青阳宫科品，以绛纹之缯三十尺，亦可三尺，金龙一枚，诣南方三炁天君南乡诸灵官九幽之中，拔赎罪魂。 三日三夜，明灯烧香，首谢天君，可得速出长夜之中，见诸光明，三年皆得更生人中，因缘不绝，转得信根。 西南世界飞天神人曰：西南无极世界恒沙众生，已得道过去及未得道见在福中善男子善女人，修奉智慧上品十戒，功德满足，身受福报，已得道者，位登上真。 未得道者，见在世上，为地祇所称，天神所敬，死升南宫，受号上补天官，总领鬼神。 西南梵炁天君告下西南地祇三官九府百二十曹，削落黄元九幽玉匮长夜之函宿世罪根。 梵天司命勒录梵天神仙簿中。 九祖普得去离三涂五苦之中，升度南宫，逍遥福堂。 后十二年皆得还生富贵之门，因缘不绝，遂得神仙。 太上道君顾问西南世界飞天神人曰：我尝历观诸天，出游西南门，见西南无极世界长夜地狱三河九江五岳之中，有百姓子男女人，身受恶对，苦痛难胜，见之悲恻，伤人肝心。 如此之辈，凡应几年，当得解脱被赦之日，当作何形，有何功德，可得拔度，还入福中。 西南世界飞天神人曰：此人前身十生人道，恒无善行，生辄元逆，一炁天君梵炁诸灵官三界主司结其罪录，依玄都女青下宫右官律，万劫得还，生下人之身作仆使，轮转十二万劫无数之周，乃得作南河都役使。 此之勤苦，非言所尽。 欲使拔度，还於善缘，当依明真玉匮女青下宫科品，以黄纹之缯一百二十尺，亦可一十二尺，金龙一枚，诣西南梵炁天君西南诸灵官九幽之中，拔赎罪魂。 一十二日一十二夜，明灯烧香，首谢天君，西南诸灵官可得开度长夜之中，见诸光明。 一十二年，皆得还生福庆之门。 西方世界飞天神人曰：西方无极世界恒沙众生，已得道过去及未得道见在福中善男子善女人，修奉智慧上品十戒，功满德报，已得道者，位登上真。 未得道者，名书太素玄台，命过升天，为太上之宾，西方白帝皆列名七炁之天。 七炁天君告下西方三官，九署地牢之中，削落白元九幽玉匮长夜之函宿世罪根。

In the present world, they possess keen intelligence and wisdom, foreseeing fortune and misfortune, or they attain spiritual clarity and far-seeing vision, commanding ghosts and spirits, or dwell within the gates of wealth, nobility, and imperial power. The Southern Red Emperor and the Southern Pole Earth Controller shall inscribe their names in the registers of the Three Qi Cinnabar Heaven and the Three Qi Heavenly Officials, and proclaim to the Three Officials, Nine Bureaus, and One Hundred Twenty Offices of the Southern Realm to expunge the karmic roots of their past sins from the Crimson Prime Nine Dark Hells and the Jade Casket of Eternal Night. The Cinnabar Heaven Controller of Destiny shall record them in the divine register of Cinnabar Heaven immortals, and their seven generations of ancestors shall universally depart from the Three Wretched Realms, ascend to the Heavenly Palaces, and roam freely in the Southern Palace. Within three years, all shall be reborn into the gates of good fortune and virtue, rejoicing in life after life, their blessings and joys beyond measure, their good affinities unbroken, and they shall attain the rank of divine immortals.

The Most High Dao Lord turned to the Flying Heavenly Deity of the Southern Boundless World and inquired: "I have often surveyed the heavens and journeyed through the Southern Gate, where I beheld in the hells of the Southern Boundless World the common folk—men and women—naked and without clothing, swallowing fire and consuming coals, their faces scorched and bodies aflame, their forms no longer human, enduring cruel retributions, their suffering beyond words. Witnessing this, I was moved to tears, my heart grieved with sorrow. How many years must such beings endure their retribution before they may be liberated? When the day of their pardon arrives, in what form shall they be reborn among humans? By what merciful method and what meritorious deeds may they be delivered and restored to good affinities?"

The Flying Heavenly Deity of the Southern Boundless World replied: "These individuals were cruel and perverse in life, devoid of the Dao. Their sins bound them to the Nine Dark Hells of Eternal Night. The Three Qi Heavenly Lords, the Cinnabar Heaven Numinous Officials, and the Three Realms’ Controllers of Destiny have recorded their transgressions. According to the statutes of the Mysterious Capital’s Female Azure Yang Palace and the Greater Yang Officials, their penal servitude spans thirty thousand kalpas, after which they shall be reborn among the six kinds of livestock to repay their karmic debts. After three million kalpas, cycling through the reckonings of Cinnabar Heaven, they may become laborers in the Three Rivers’ offices, their toil and suffering beyond description. If one wishes to deliver them and sever their evil affinities, hastening their return to the human realm, they must follow the statutes of the Luminous Perfected Jade Casket and the Female Azure Lower Palace: with thirty feet of crimson-patterned silk (or three feet), and one golden dragon, they shall journey to the Southern Three Qi Heavenly Lord and the Southern Region’s Numinous Officials within the Nine Dark Hells to redeem the sinful souls. For three days and three nights, they shall light lamps and burn incense, bowing in gratitude to the Heavenly Lords. Thus, they may swiftly emerge from the Eternal Night, behold the radiant lights, and within three years, all shall be reborn among humans, their affinities unbroken, and they shall turn toward the root of faith."

The Flying Heavenly Deity of the Southwestern World declared: "In the Southwestern Boundless World, the multitude of beings as numerous as the sands of the Ganges—those who have already attained the Dao in past lives and those presently virtuous men and women of good fortune who have yet to attain the Dao—who cultivate and uphold the Ten Upper-Grade Precepts of Wisdom, when their merit is complete and their virtue perfected, shall receive their karmic rewards. Those who have attained the Dao shall ascend to the rank of Highest Perfected. Those who have not yet attained the Dao shall, in their present lives, be praised by earth deities and revered by heavenly spirits. Upon death, they shall ascend to the Southern Palace, receive the title of Heavenly Official of the Upper Supplement, and govern ghosts and spirits. The Southwestern Primal Qi Heavenly Lord shall proclaim to the Earth Deities, Three Officials, Nine Bureaus, and One Hundred Twenty Offices of the Southwestern Realm to expunge the karmic roots of their past sins from the Yellow Prime Nine Dark Hells and the Jade Casket of Eternal Night. The Primal Heaven Controller of Destiny shall inscribe their names in the divine register of Primal Heaven immortals. Their nine generations of ancestors shall universally depart from the Three Wretched Realms and the Five Sufferings, ascend to the Southern Palace, and roam freely in the Hall of Blessings. After twelve years, all shall be reborn into the gates of wealth and nobility, their affinities unbroken, and they shall attain the rank of divine immortals."

The Most High Dao Lord turned to the Flying Heavenly Deity of the Southwestern World and inquired: "I have often surveyed the heavens and journeyed through the Southwestern Gate, where I beheld in the Eternal Night Hells of the Southwestern Boundless World—within the Three Rivers, Nine Streams, and Five Peaks—the common folk, men and women, enduring cruel retributions, their suffering unbearable. Witnessing this, I was filled with sorrow, my heart grieved. How many years must such beings endure before they may be liberated? When the day of their pardon arrives, in what form shall they be reborn? By what meritorious deeds may they be delivered and restored to good fortune?"

The Flying Heavenly Deity of the Southwestern World replied: "In their past ten human lives, these individuals committed no good deeds, living in constant rebellion. The Primal Qi Heavenly Lord, the Primal Qi Numinous Officials, and the Three Realms’ Controllers of Destiny have recorded their transgressions. According to the statutes of the Mysterious Capital’s Female Azure Lower Palace and the Right Officials, after ten thousand kalpas, they may be reborn as lowly servants. After cycling through one hundred twenty thousand kalpas of countless revolutions, they may become laborers in the Southern River offices, their toil and suffering beyond words. If one wishes to deliver them and restore their good affinities, they must follow the statutes of the Luminous Perfected Jade Casket and the Female Azure Lower Palace: with one hundred twenty feet of yellow-patterned silk (or twelve feet), and one golden dragon, they shall journey to the Southwestern Primal Qi Heavenly Lord and the Southwestern Numinous Officials within the Nine Dark Hells to redeem the sinful souls. For twelve days and twelve nights, they shall light lamps and burn incense, bowing in gratitude to the Heavenly Lords and the Southwestern Numinous Officials. Thus, they may be delivered from the Eternal Night and behold the radiant lights. Within twelve years, all shall be reborn into the gates of good fortune and blessings."

The Flying Heavenly Deity of the Western World declared: "In the Western Boundless World, the multitude of beings as numerous as the sands of the Ganges—those who have already attained the Dao in past lives and those presently virtuous men and women of good fortune who have yet to attain the Dao—who cultivate and uphold the Ten Upper-Grade Precepts of Wisdom, when their merit is complete and their virtue rewarded, those who have attained the Dao shall ascend to the rank of Highest Perfected. Those who have not yet attained the Dao shall have their names inscribed in the Mysterious Terrace of the Great Simplicity, their lives transcended and their souls ascended to heaven, becoming guests of the Most High. The Western White Emperor shall inscribe their names in the Seven Qi Heaven. The Seven Qi Heavenly Lord shall proclaim to the Three Officials of the Western Realm and the Nine Offices of the Earthly Prisons to expunge the karmic roots of their past sins from the White Prime Nine Dark Hells and the Jade Casket of Eternal Night."

The Director of Destiny in the Plain Heaven shall inscribe their names in the registers of divine immortals among the heavens. Their seven generations of ancestors shall universally depart from the Three Wicked Paths and the Five Sufferings, ascending to the Golden Portals to receive natural blessings, roaming the Hall of Fortune, and enjoying boundless joy. In later rebirths among humankind, they shall be revered as human dignitaries, respected by the Three Realms, and praised by ghosts and spirits. As their wheel of fortune turns, all shall attain the rank of divine immortals.

The Most High Dao Lord turned to the Flying Celestial Beings of the Western Realm and inquired: "I have often surveyed the heavens and journeyed through the Western Gate, where I beheld the Nine Dark Hells of Eternal Night in the Western Realm of the Infinite, as well as the Three Rivers and Nine Streams among the mountains, where male and female ghostly souls are punished and toil, drifting through the Three Wicked Paths and enduring the full weight of the Five Sufferings. What past karmic retribution has brought these beings to suffer such punishment? In how many years may they attain liberation, and what meritorious deeds may redeem and deliver them?"

The Flying Celestial Beings of the Western Realm replied: "These beings, in their past lives, acted contrary to the Dao. The Seven Qi Heavenly Lord, the various spirit officials of the Western Realm, and the governing authorities of the Three Realms have recorded their transgressions. According to the statutes of the Dark Bureau of the Right Palace of the Mysterious Capital’s Lady of Qing, after ten thousand kalpas, they may be reborn in the frontier barbarian lands, possessing human form but lacking human sentiment. After seventy thousand kalpas, when the reckoning of the White Emperor has completed its cycles, they may become laborers under the command of the Western Peak. This suffering is endless, their toil beyond words. Should one wish to deliver them and restore them to good karmic conditions, they must follow the regulations of the Jade Casket of Luminous Perfection and the statutes of the Right Palace of the Lady of Qing: present seventy feet of white silk—or seven feet—and one golden dragon to the Seven Qi Heavenly Lord, the various spirit officials of the Western Realm, and the Nine Dark Hells to redeem their karmic roots. For seven days and seven nights, keep bright lamps lit and burn incense, prostrating before the Heavenly Lord to seek deliverance. Thus may they behold the light. After seven years, all shall be reborn into the families of the virtuous."

The Flying Celestial Beings of the Northwestern Realm declared: "Among the boundless multitudes of the Northwestern Realm of the Infinite, both those who have attained the Dao in past lives and those good men and women of present good fortune who have yet to attain the Dao—who cultivate and uphold the Ten Upper-Grade Precepts of Wisdom—when their merit is complete and their virtue rewarded, those who have attained the Dao shall ascend to the rank of Highest Perfected. Those who have not yet attained the Dao shall have their names inscribed in the Nine Heavens, their lives transcended and their souls ascended to heaven, where they shall consort with the Five Emperors. The Yellow Emperor shall inscribe their names in the Heaven of Brahma Qi. The Heavenly Lord of Brahma Qi shall proclaim to the Three Officials of the Northwestern Realm and the Nine Offices of the Earthly Prisons to expunge the karmic roots of their past sins from the Yellow Prime Nine Dark Hells and the Jade Casket of Eternal Night."

The Director of Destiny in the Brahma Heaven shall inscribe their names in the registers of divine immortals among the heavens. Their seven generations of ancestors shall all depart from the Five Paths, ascending to the Nine Heavens to receive boundless blessings. In later rebirths among humankind, they shall be courageous and diligent, their might prevailing over the Five Directions. With unbroken karmic conditions, they shall be appointed as Perfected Ones of the Five Emperors.

The Most High Dao Lord turned to the Flying Celestial Beings of the Northwestern Realm and inquired: "I have often surveyed the heavens and journeyed through the Northwestern Gate, where I beheld the hells of the Northwestern Realm of the Infinite—the Nine Streams of Eternal Night and the Frozen Courts of Darkness—where the common folk, men and women, suffer in filth and drift in torment, their bodies lashed and afflicted with unbearable agony. How many years must such beings endure punishment before they may attain liberation? When pardoned, what form shall they take upon returning to the human realm?"

chunks.original_text: 如未开恕，有何功德，可相拔度。 西北世界飞天神人曰：斯人所行酷逆无度，一炁天君西北诸灵官三界主司结其罪簿，依玄都女青太阴官水官律，万劫当得生愚暗之中，聋盲六疾，非复人形。 轮转五道，一十二万劫无数之周，乃得补长河都役使。 此之悠悠，勤苦难言。 欲使开度，还入善门，当依明真玉匮女青太阴宫科品，以黄纹之缯百二十尺，亦可一十二尺，金龙一枚，诣西北一炁天君西北诸灵官，九幽之中拔赎罪魂。 一十二日一十二夜，明灯烧香，首谢天君，可得开度，见诸光明。 一十二年，便得自在，更生人中，还入善缘之门，世世欢乐，长享无穷。 北方世界飞天神人曰：北方无极世界恒沙众生，已得道过去及未得道见在福中善男子善女人，修奉智慧上品十戒，功德备足，玄天福报，名书上清。 或位登上圣，游行三清，或命过，即得为四极明公j 见在世上福德之中，神灵敬护，万灾不干。 北方地司，皆列言上宫，五炁天君告下北方三官九府百二十曹，削落玄元九幽玉匮长夜之函宿世罪根。 玄天司命勒录诸天神仙簿中。 七祖普得上升天堂，衣食自然。 五年皆得更生帝王之门，轮转福德，故恒居善缘。 太上道君顾问北方世界飞天神人曰：我尝历观诸天，出游北门，见北方无极世界地狱之中，三河九江诸山，责役百姓子男女人，涂炭流曳，负山担石，闭塞长源，吞火瞰炭，无复身形。 其人受对被责，几年应得解脱，解脱之日，为还人中，复作何身中，复可得拔度与不。 北方世界飞天神人曰：斯人生世酷逆无道，五炁天君北方诸灵官三界主司结其罪录，依玄都女青太阳宫火官律，万劫当生六畜之中，轮转五道五万劫玄天数周，乃得补北岳都役使。 其对悠悠，难可卒还。 欲使开度，速见命根，当依明真玉匮女青太阳宫科品，以玄纹之缯五十尺，亦可五尺，金龙一枚，诣五炁天君北方诸灵官九幽之中，拔赎罪魂。 五日五夜，明灯烧香，首谢天君，可得开度见诸光明。 五年身皆还生善缘之中。 东北世界飞天神人曰：东北无极世界恒沙众生，已得道过去及未得道见在福中善男子善女人，修奉智慧上品十戒，功成德报，已得道者，位登上真，未得道者，见在世上，为三界所敬，地祇所畏，死升天堂，灵人交游。 东北地司皆列言梵炁之天梵炁天君，告下东北三官九府百二十曹，削落黄元九幽玉匮长夜之函宿世罪根，梵天司命勒录诸天神仙簿中。 九祖升度南宫，去离五道，逍遥福堂。 五年皆得还生福德之门，世世因缘，享福无穷。 太上道君顾问东北世界飞天神人曰：我尝历观诸天，出游东北门，见东北无极世界地狱之中，有百姓子男女人，身受宿对，诸苦备经，流曳涂炭，无复人形。 其人何辜，生世何犯，杀害何命，致受今对。 当作何功，拔赎罪身，使得还入善道之中。 东北世界飞天神人曰：斯人前生不念慈心，三春游猎，张罗布网，放火烧山，刺射野兽，杀害众生，其罪深重，死受殃罚，身负槌打，万痛交行，驱驰百极，食息无宁。 欲拔比罪，还於福中，当依明真科品，以黄纹之缯百二十尺，亦可一十二尺，金龙一枚，以诣东北梵炁天君东北诸灵官九幽之府，拔赎罪魂。 一十二日一十二夜，烧香然灯，照耀诸天地狱之中，使长徒幽魂得见光明，罪根披散，还入福门，魂升南宫，受庆自然。

If pardon has not yet been granted, what merits or virtues may be cultivated to deliver them?

The Flying Celestial Beings of the Northwestern Realm replied: "Such beings have committed acts of extreme cruelty and transgression. The Qi Sovereign of the Northwest and the various spirit-officials, along with the overseers of the Three Realms, have recorded their sins in the ledgers. According to the statutes of the Mysterious Capital’s Lady of the Dark Yin, the Water Bureau, and the Palace of the Hidden Moon, they are condemned to ten thousand kalpas of rebirth in realms of ignorance and darkness, afflicted with deafness, blindness, and the six maladies, no longer retaining human form. They shall revolve through the Five Paths for one hundred twenty thousand kalpas, countless cycles, before they may be appointed as laborers in the Long River Bureau. This suffering is boundless, their toil beyond description.

Should one wish to deliver them and guide them back into the gate of goodness, they must follow the statutes of the Luminous Perfected Jade Treasury and the Lady of the Dark Yin’s Palace. Offer one hundred twenty feet of yellow-patterned silk—or as little as twelve feet—and a golden dragon, presenting them to the Qi Sovereign of the Northwest, the various spirit-officials of the Northwest, and the Nine Dark Prisons to ransom the sinful souls. For twelve days and twelve nights, light lamps and burn incense, bowing in repentance before the Sovereign. Thus may they attain deliverance and behold the radiant light. After twelve years, they shall gain freedom, be reborn among humans, and re-enter the gate of good karmic conditions, enjoying boundless joy for generations to come."

The Flying Celestial Beings of the Northern Realm said: "In the Northern Realm of the Infinite, among the countless sentient beings—both those who have already attained the Dao in past lives and those presently abiding in blessed goodness, the virtuous men and women who cultivate and uphold the Ten Precepts of Supreme Wisdom—when their merits and virtues are complete, their celestial rewards shall be inscribed in the Upper Clarity. Some ascend to the rank of highest sages, roaming the Three Clarities; others, upon the end of their lives, become Illustrious Lords of the Four Poles. In their present existence, they dwell in blessed virtue, revered by spirits and protected from the myriad calamities. The earthly bureaus of the North shall report to the Celestial Palace, where the Five Qi Sovereigns instruct the Three Officials, Nine Courts, and One Hundred Twenty Offices of the North to erase from the Jade Treasury of the Nine Dark Prisons and the Eternal Night Archives the roots of their past sins. The Northern Celestial Bureau of Destiny shall inscribe their names in the registers of divine immortals. Their seven generations of ancestors shall universally ascend to the Heavenly Halls, clothed and nourished by nature. Within five years, they shall all be reborn into the gates of emperors and kings, revolving through cycles of blessed virtue, forever abiding in good karmic conditions."

The Most High Dao Lord turned to the Flying Celestial Beings of the Northern Realm and inquired: "I have often surveyed the heavens and journeyed through the Northern Gate, where I beheld the hells of the Northern Realm of the Infinite—the Three Rivers, Nine Streams, and myriad mountains—where the common folk, men and women, suffer their retributions, dragged through filth and torment, bearing mountains and stones upon their backs, blocking the eternal springs, swallowing fire and gazing upon coals, their bodies no longer retaining human form. How many years must such beings endure punishment before they may attain liberation? When pardoned, what form shall they take upon returning to the human realm? May they be delivered, or not?"

The Flying Celestial Beings of the Northern Realm replied: "Such beings, in their past lives, committed acts of extreme cruelty and lawlessness. The Five Qi Sovereign of the North and the various spirit-officials, along with the overseers of the Three Realms, have recorded their sins. According to the statutes of the Mysterious Capital’s Lady of the Luminous Yang, the Fire Bureau, they are condemned to ten thousand kalpas of rebirth among the six livestock. They shall revolve through the Five Paths for fifty thousand kalpas, countless cycles of the Northern Celestial reckoning, before they may be appointed as laborers in the Northern Marchmount Bureau. Their retribution is vast, their repayment not swiftly fulfilled.

Should one wish to deliver them and swiftly restore their life’s root, they must follow the statutes of the Luminous Perfected Jade Treasury and the Lady of the Luminous Yang’s Palace. Offer fifty feet of dark-patterned silk—or as little as five feet—and a golden dragon, presenting them to the Five Qi Sovereign of the North, the various spirit-officials, and the Nine Dark Prisons to ransom the sinful souls. For five days and five nights, light lamps and burn incense, bowing in repentance before the Sovereign. Thus may they attain deliverance and behold the radiant light. Within five years, their bodies shall be reborn into good karmic conditions."

The Flying Celestial Beings of the Northeastern Realm said: "In the Northeastern Realm of the Infinite, among the countless sentient beings—both those who have already attained the Dao in past lives and those presently abiding in blessed goodness, the virtuous men and women who cultivate and uphold the Ten Precepts of Supreme Wisdom—when their merits and virtues are complete, those who have attained the Dao ascend to the rank of highest perfected ones, while those who have not yet attained the Dao, in their present existence, are revered by the Three Realms and feared by earthly deities. Upon death, they ascend to the Heavenly Halls, where divine beings welcome them. The earthly bureaus of the Northeast shall report to the Celestial Palace of Brahma Qi, where the Brahma Qi Sovereign instructs the Three Officials, Nine Courts, and One Hundred Twenty Offices of the Northeast to erase from the Yellow Prime Jade Treasury of the Nine Dark Prisons and the Eternal Night Archives the roots of their past sins. The Brahma Celestial Bureau of Destiny shall inscribe their names in the registers of divine immortals. Their nine generations of ancestors shall ascend to the Southern Palace, departing the Five Paths to dwell in the Halls of Blessedness. Within five years, they shall all be reborn into the gates of blessed virtue, their karmic conditions spanning generations, enjoying boundless felicity."

The Most High Dao Lord turned to the Flying Celestial Beings of the Northeastern Realm and inquired: "I have often surveyed the heavens and journeyed through the Northeastern Gate, where I beheld the hells of the Northeastern Realm of the Infinite, where the common folk, men and women, endure their past retributions, suffering every torment, dragged through filth and mire, their bodies no longer retaining human form. What crimes did they commit in past lives? What offenses did they incur? Whose lives did they take, that they now endure such retribution? What merits must be cultivated to ransom their sinful bodies and guide them back into the path of goodness?"

The Flying Celestial Beings of the Northeastern Realm replied: "In their past lives, these beings lacked compassion. During the three spring months, they roamed hunting, setting nets and snares, burning mountains, and shooting wild beasts, slaughtering countless lives. Their sins are grave, and in death, they suffer the consequences—beaten with clubs, a thousand pains assailing them, driven through the hundred extremes, never resting in eating or sleeping.

To deliver them from such sins and restore them to blessedness, one must follow the statutes of the Luminous Perfected. Offer one hundred twenty feet of yellow-patterned silk—or as little as twelve feet—and a golden dragon, presenting them to the Brahma Qi Sovereign of the Northeast, the various spirit-officials, and the Nine Dark Prisons. For twelve days and twelve nights, burn incense and light lamps, illuminating the hells of heaven and earth, so that the long-imprisoned souls may behold the radiant light, their sinful roots dispersed. Thus may they return to the gate of blessedness, their souls ascending to the Southern Palace to receive natural rejoicing."

The Flying Celestial Beings of the Lower Realm declare: In the boundless worlds of the Lower Realm, among the countless sentient beings—those who have attained the Dao as Earth Immortals and the Perfected of the Five Peaks, as well as the virtuous men and women still abiding in blessedness who have yet to attain the Dao—those who cultivate and uphold the Ten Precepts of Supreme Wisdom, their merits complete and virtues fulfilled, shall ascend as Highest Perfected if they have already attained the Dao. Those who have not yet attained it shall have their names inscribed in the heavens, and upon the passing of their lives, they shall ascend directly to the Hall of Blessings. The Five Emperors of the Five Peaks in the Eastern Florescence Palace shall proclaim to the Thirty-Two Heavenly Lords of the Heavens, and command the Eight Extremes, the Three Officials, the Nine Bureaus, and the earthly prisons to erase the records of their sins from the Jade Archives of the Nine Dark Prisons, severing the karmic roots of their past lives. The Heavenly Registrars shall inscribe their names in the Golden Register of Divine Immortals. Their seven generations of ancestors shall be freed from earthly toil, ascending to the Southern Palace. In their next lives, they shall be born into gates of wealth and nobility, where they may accumulate merit through diligent cultivation, tirelessly turning the wheel of existence until they attain flight and ascend to the Great Ultimate, achieving the rank of Divine Immortals.

The Most High Lord of the Dao turned and asked the Flying Celestial Beings of the boundless worlds of the Lower Realm: "I have often observed the Lower Realm, journeying through the Eight Extremes. I have seen in the hells of the boundless worlds below men and women enduring cruel retributions, bound together in suffering, mired in the filth of the Eight Extremes among the imprisoned multitudes. For what crimes were they born? What transgressions did they commit in life? Which scriptures or laws did they violate to suffer such retribution? What meritorious deeds must be performed to redeem their past offenses, allowing them to be reborn into the human realm?"

The Flying Celestial Beings of the Lower Realm replied: "These beings, in their past lives, disrespected spirits and deities, rejected the teachings of the scriptures, and offended the Earth Spirits, the Five Peaks, and the Four Waterways—sins beyond reckoning. After death, they endure cruel punishments, sinking into the dark hells, and without the statutes of the Luminous Perfected to deliver them, they would remain bound for ten thousand kalpas without release. To liberate them, one must offer thirty-two feet of yellow-patterned silk and a golden dragon, presenting them to the various earthly administrations, the Five Peaks, the famous mountains, the Three Officials of the waters, the Nine Bureaus, the Twelve River Sources, and the Nine Dark Prisons to redeem the sinful souls. For one day and one night, through the twelve hours, burn incense and light lamps, illuminating the depths of the earth and the Nine Dark Prisons, so that the long-imprisoned dead souls may behold the radiant light, receive deliverance, and return to the gate of blessedness."

The Flying Celestial Beings of the Upper Realm declare: In the boundless worlds of the Thirty-Two Heavens of the Upper Realm, among the countless sentient beings—those who have attained the Dao as Highest Sages, Lofty Spirits, and the various Perfected Ones, as well as the men and women still abiding in blessedness who have yet to attain the Dao—those who cultivate and uphold the Ten Precepts of Supreme Wisdom, their merits complete and virtues fulfilled, shall ascend as Highest Perfected if they have already attained the Dao. Upon the passing of their lives, they shall ascend directly to the Hall of Blessings, roaming freely above the Three Realms and the Great Veil, where the heavens make special distinction for them. In the long nights of the Nine Dark Prisons, their records of sin shall be erased, their seven generations of ancestors delivered, ascending to the Southern Palace. Reborn into the human realm, they shall cultivate the good Dao, their karmic affinities spanning lifetimes, their joys unending. They shall attain the rank of Divine Immortals, soaring through the Three Realms and the heavens of the Great Veil.

The Most High Lord of the Dao turned and asked the Flying Celestial Beings of the Upper Realm: "I have often observed the Thirty-Two Heavens of the Upper Realm, journeying through the Three Realms. I have seen in the Northern Prison of Heaven, the Azure Luminous Upper Prison, and the Three Rivers’ Repository of Accumulated Darkness men and women naked and bare, deprived of clothing and food, their bodies beaten with iron rods, enduring unbearable suffering. They are dragged through the Three Rivers, drawing and hauling floodwaters to irrigate the Four Waterways, toiling day and night without rest. For what crimes in life did they transgress? chunks.original_text: 上方世界飞天神人曰：其人前身不信大法，疑毁经文，违犯十戒，致受今对，充天徒责。 自非明真科品拔度，万劫无还。 夫欲开度，常以青纹之缯三十二尺，金龙一枚，以诣诸天宫曹府，拔赎宿对，开度九幽之中囚徒死魂。 一日一夜一十二时，烧香然灯，照耀诸天，积夜之河，九幽之中，使责役之鬼得见光明，身受开度，还入福门。 太上道君欢喜作礼，上白天尊：今日侍坐，得闻十方飞天神人说诸罪根拔度上品，生者得度，死者得还，九幽之内，普受光明。 来生男女，善心信向，当得其福，世世因缘，玩好不绝，身得神仙，香灯供养，门户兴隆，三界侍卫，万灵朝门，鬼试降伏，千灾不干。 大法开化，万劫无穷，福庆堂堂，巍巍难胜。 欣诸来生，得此大恩，不胜喜悦，而作颂日。 是时诸天一时称善。 太上智慧长乐颂 龙汉多纯民，混心皆自然。 五情不争竞，形有不死神。 龙门断长河，三涂不役人。 休息五道场，罢除刀剑山。 荡荡元汉内，九幽无苦魂。 不闻哭尸声，但闻长乐言。 不见长夜鬼，但见飞天仙。 斯世乐何乐，故诵兴乐篇。 诸天稽首庆，同称庆劫年。 玄都七宝林，十天普弥罗。 紫烟观灵晖，云景秀玉阿。 上有福德堂，宫室互参差。 皆是清信士，真仙飞天家。 三界通玄路，五道清不邪。 善根应缘生，累功享福多。 牵对相寻续，大法谅不虚。 无有万年人，皆与劫同祖。 依依欢乐世，发言成庆歌。 此世观无极，当奈来运何。 太上道君於洞阳馆柏陵舍中受戒，见诸天福堂亿劫种亲，并逍遥无为，衣食自然，身有光明，飞仙同侣，无有忧戚，不知苦难，见之悲喜，故作长乐颂篇。 太上智慧苦神颂 生落苦神界，轮转五道庭。 九幽闭长夜，累劫无光明。 刀山多剑树，毒刃互峥嵘。 不见群鸟集，但闻苦魂声。 回风摇长条，哀响流寒庭。 上有履山人，时刻无暂停。 饥食曲泉炭，渴饮冶火精。 流曳三涂中，岂识形与名。 念尔不知命，苦哉伤人情。 罪福各生缘，善恶谅由心。 轮转不终灭，譬声不绝音。 九幽有元录，万劫自相寻。 寒冰无极源，长夜间重阴。 不见福德舍，但见穷鬼林。 长河难闭塞，苦魂攀领吟。 孤声赴绝一剑，哀号落刀岑。 此形非复形，痛哉伤人衿。 太上道君出游八门，见诸地狱幽闭重槛，及三河九江刀山剑树，囚徒饿鬼，责役死魂，流曳涂炭，无复身形，不可忍见。 见之悲伤，故作苦神颂篇。 天尊告一太上道君曰：今日普与十方至真、无极大圣众，同生一劫，欢乐难譬，言不觉尽，心不觉现。 说诸善恶、禁戒科律，无所藏隐，诸天同庆，齐宣法音，普度无量。 今生何幸，遇此经教，自发善心，命得长年，不横夭伤。 终归之日，径上天堂，因缘无绝，皆得道真。 吾念来生末世男女，皆当随运自从，心迫情急，不觉生罪，罪根当生，沦於五道，一跌信路，无复还期，往返三途五苦之中，刀山剑树，飞血万里，无极寒冰，穷魂填夜，号咷长何，悲吟伤人。 哀此不幸，往不能还。 今故说是经，为诸来生信向之人，开通津梁，普令得去恶对之根，身入光明，还於善缘。 至心宗奉，当得其福，不信向者，当获其殃。 吾过去后，其文当还大罗之上七宝玄台紫微宫中。 如明真玄科，四万劫当行下世，教度天人。
chunks.translated_text:
The Flying Celestial Beings of the Upper Realm replied: "In their past lives, these beings did not believe in the Great Dao, doubted and defiled the scriptures, and violated the Ten Precepts, thus receiving their present retribution as forced laborers in Heaven. Without the illumination of the true statutes and deliverance, they shall remain bound for ten thousand kalpas without return. To liberate them, one must offer thirty-two feet of azure-patterned silk and a golden dragon, presenting them at the celestial palaces and bureaus to redeem their past transgressions and deliver the imprisoned dead souls from the Nine Dark Realms. For twelve hours day and night, burn incense and light lamps to illuminate the heavens, the River of Accumulated Darkness, and the Nine Dark Realms, allowing the toiling spirits to behold the light, receive deliverance, and return to the Gate of Blessings."

The Most High Lord Dao turned and bowed, addressing the Heavenly Worthy: "Today, seated in attendance, I have heard the Flying Celestial Beings of the Ten Directions expound upon the superior methods for uprooting karmic transgressions. The living are delivered, the dead are restored, and within the Nine Dark Realms, all receive illumination. In future lives, men and women who cultivate goodness and faith shall attain this blessing. Through endless kalpas, their affinities shall flourish without cease, their bodies attaining immortality. With incense and lamps offered in devotion, their households shall prosper, guarded by the Three Realms, attended by the myriad spirits. Demons shall be subdued, and a thousand calamities averted. The Great Dao unfolds, its boundless virtue resplendent, towering and unmatched. Rejoicing in the blessings bestowed upon future generations, I cannot contain my joy and have composed this hymn."

At that moment, all the heavens as one voiced their approval.

**Hymn of Everlasting Joy by the Most High Wisdom**
In the Dragon Han, the people were pure,
Their hearts in harmony with the natural Way.
The five emotions knew no strife,
Their forms possessed undying spirits.
The Dragon Gate severed the long river,
The Three Paths no longer enslaved men.
Resting in the Five Dao sanctuaries,
The Mountain of Swords and Blades was abolished.
Vast and boundless within the Primordial Han,
The Nine Dark Realms held no suffering souls.
No wailing of the dead was heard,
Only words of everlasting joy.
No long-night ghosts were seen,
Only soaring celestial immortals.
What joy surpasses this world’s joy?
Thus I chant this hymn of jubilation.
The heavens bowed in celebration,
Together proclaiming this blessed kalpa.
In the Seven Jeweled Grove of the Mysterious Capital,
The Ten Heavens enveloped in radiant mist,
Purple clouds observed the numinous glow,
Cloudscapes adorned the jade peaks.
Above stood the Hall of Blessings,
Its palaces and chambers arrayed in splendor.
All were faithful devotees,
True immortals and celestial families.
The Three Realms opened the path of mystery,
The Five Paths purified, free from deviation.
Good roots arise from karmic conditions,
Accumulated merit yields abundant blessings.
Karmic ties follow in succession,
The Great Dao is surely not in vain.
No man lives ten thousand years,
All share the same origin as the kalpa.
In this joyous world of harmony,
Words become songs of celebration.
Gazing upon this boundless realm,
What shall become of the ages to come?

At the Cypress Mound Abode within the Grotto of Radiant Yang, the Most High Lord Dao received the precepts and beheld the celestial halls of blessings, where the karmic kin of countless kalpas dwelled in carefree non-action, their clothing and sustenance naturally provided, their bodies radiant with light, accompanied by flying immortals. Free from sorrow and grief, unaware of suffering and hardship, he was moved by both sorrow and joy, and thus composed the *Hymn of Everlasting Joy*.

**Hymn of the Suffering Spirits by the Most High Wisdom**
Born into the realm of suffering spirits,
They revolve through the courts of the Five Paths.
The Nine Dark Realms enclose the eternal night,
Through countless kalpas, no light shines.
Blade mountains and sword trees stand tall,
Their poisoned edges gleaming sharp.
No flocks of birds gather,
Only the cries of suffering souls are heard.
The whirling winds sway the long branches,
Mournful echoes drift through the cold courts.
Above, the mountain-treading souls,
Toil ceaselessly, without respite.
Hungry, they eat the crooked spring’s charcoal,
Thirsty, they drink the smelting fire’s essence.
Dragged through the Three Paths,
Do they even know their names?
Pitying their ignorance of fate,
Alas, how it grieves the heart.
Karma arises from good and evil,
Virtue and vice surely stem from the mind.
The wheel of rebirth never ceases,
Like sound that never fades from echo.
The Nine Dark Realms hold primordial records,
Through ten thousand kalpas, they seek one another.
The source of endless icy cold,
The long night pierced by layers of darkness.
No halls of blessings are seen,
Only forests of destitute ghosts.
The long river cannot be dammed,
Suffering souls cling and wail.
Their solitary cries reach the edge of the sword,
Their lamentations fall upon the blade peaks.
These forms are no longer forms,
Alas, how it wounds the heart.

The Most High Lord Dao, journeying through the Eight Gates, beheld the prisons of the underworld, their layered barriers, the Three Rivers and Nine Streams, the mountains of blades and forests of swords, the imprisoned hungry ghosts, the toiling dead souls, dragged through the mire and ashes, their forms no longer recognizable. Unable to bear the sight, he was moved to sorrow and thus composed the *Hymn of the Suffering Spirits*.

The Heavenly Worthy addressed the Most High Lord Dao: "Today, together with the perfected beings of the Ten Directions and the boundless assembly of great sages, we share the joy of this kalpa, a happiness beyond compare. Our words cannot express it fully, nor can our hearts comprehend it entirely. The teachings of good and evil, the precepts and statutes, have been revealed without concealment. The heavens rejoice as one, proclaiming the Dharma, universally delivering the boundless multitudes. How fortunate are those born in this age, encountering these scriptural teachings! By cultivating goodness, their lives shall be long, free from untimely death. When their final day arrives, they shall ascend directly to the celestial halls, their karmic ties unbroken, all attaining the true Dao.

Yet I pity the men and women of future degenerate ages, who shall follow the turning of the kalpa, their hearts constrained by urgency, unknowingly committing sins. Their karmic roots shall sprout, casting them into the Five Paths. Once they stumble from the path of faith, there shall be no return. They shall wander through the Three Paths and the Five Sufferings, amidst blade mountains and sword trees, where blood flies for ten thousand miles, through endless icy cold, where destitute souls fill the night, their wails and lamentations grieving the heart. Alas for their misfortune, once gone, they cannot return.

Thus, I expound this scripture for the faithful of future generations, opening the bridge to liberation, enabling all to sever the roots of evil karma, enter the light, and return to goodness. Those who wholeheartedly revere and uphold it shall attain its blessings; those who do not believe shall incur its misfortune.

After my departure, this text shall return to the Seven Jeweled Mysterious Terrace within the Purple Tenuity Palace of the Great Luo. In accordance with the statutes of the Illuminated True Mystery, after forty thousand kalpas, it shall descend to the world to teach and deliver the heavens and humanity."
